snippet: Unions say they will rally behind a broader agenda, seeking to counter business and conservative groups pushing for cuts in social programs and tax breaks for corporations and the wealthy.
abstract: Labor leaders, having helped Pres Obama win re-election, intend to offer him their robust support for what they view as his mandate: stand tough against cuts in Medicare, Medicaid and Social Security and to keep pushing to raise taxes on the wealthy.
lead_paragraph: Unions say they will rally behind a broader agenda, seeking to counter business and conservative groups pushing for cuts in social programs and tax breaks for corporations and the wealthy.

headline.seo: Unions Offer Support for President Obama’s Tax Plan
headline.main: Labor Leaders Have Obama’s Back, and Are Ready to Help
headline.print_headline: Labor Leaders Have Obama’s Back, and Are Ready to Help
